description: A record number of residents are flocking to Shenzhen for cheap food and a good time, accelerating an integration once rejected by the city’s freedom-loving youth.
title: Young Hong Kongers Who Defied Xi Are Now Partying in China

description: Vice President Kamala Harris called for a temporary cease-fire between Israel and Hamas, including a deal in which hostages taken into the Gaza Strip in the Oct. 7 attack would be released.
title: Harris Calls for Gaza Cease-Fire, Release of Israeli Hostages

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt announced new funding to support the UK’s manufacturing sector, ahead of his budget Wednesday that he said would focus on long-term growth.
title: Hunt Announces UK Manufacturing Funding in Budget Growth Push

description: China is set to announce its 2024 growth target and outline its strategy for supporting the slowing economy at the nation’s most high-profile annual political gathering this week.
title: China to Unveil GDP Target, Avoid ‘Bazooka’ Stimulus at Meeting

description: Greece is moving forward with the sale of its stake in Piraeus Bank, according to an announcement by the Hellenic Financial Stability Fund.
title: Greece May Sell Entire Stake in Piraeus Bank as Offer Begins

description: China would be barred from buying oil from the US’s emergency stockpiles under a provision included in must-pass government funding legislation unveiled Sunday.
title: China Barred From Buying US Oil Reserves in Funding Bill

description: US congressional leaders revealed a detailed agreement to keep large parts of the government operating through Sept. 30, hoping it can be enacted before another shutdown deadline at the end of the week.
title: Congress Reveals Plan to Fund Parts of US Government Through September

description: The US Supreme Court hinted it might rule Monday on efforts to bar Donald Trump from the presidential election ballot in Colorado, adding a new opinion day to their calendar just as voters prepare to head to the polls in that state.
title: Supreme Court Ruling Due Monday With Trump’s Ballot Case Pending

description: It was not long ago Southeast Asia saw Australia’s foreign policy as being too closely hitched to that of the US. But a gathering of regional leaders in Melbourne this week shows how Canberra wants to carve its own path.
title: Australia, Southeast Asia Push to Bolster Ties in China’s Shadow

description: President Vladimir Putin is looking to divide Ukraine’s allies with a disinformation campaign, Germany’s defense minister said, days after Russian media published a leaked conversation about the possible deployment of German long-range missiles in Ukraine.
title: Germany’s Pistorius Says Russian Leak Part of Disinformation War

description: Democratic senators called on President Joe Biden to press Israel for a cease-fire in the Gaza Strip, citing recent deaths of Palestinian civilians in its war with Hamas and what they portrayed as a lagging US response to the humanitarian crisis.
title: Senate Democrats Step Up Calls for Biden to Rein In Israel’s War

description: Marine Le Pen kicked off her campaign for the European parliament elections attacking President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to reform the labor market, saying the French people would pay the price.
title: Le Pen Kicks Off EU Campaign Slamming Macron’s Labor Rules Plan

description: Nikki Haley signaled she may decline to endorse Donald Trump in an election rematch with President Joe Biden, saying she no longer considers herself bound by a pledge to the Republican National Committee to support the party’s 2024 nominee.
title: Haley Casts Doubt on GOP Nominee Pledge After Trump’s Power Play

description: When Shehbaz Sharif first became Pakistan’s prime minister two years ago, he had to persuade a fractious coalition and an angry public to swallow unpopular measures in order to save the nation from default. This time it’s worse.
title: Pakistan’s Sharif Faces an Even Tougher Task Second Time Around

description: Hello again. Here’s what we’re talking about heading into the new week.
title: Hunt on the Hot Seat to Deliver on Budget: Sunday UK Briefing

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said his budget will be “prudent” and “responsible,” as he tried to temper expectations of Conservative MPs who want eye-catching tax cuts to give their party a pre-election boost.
title: Hunt Pledges ‘Prudent, Responsible’ Budget as MPs Want Tax Cuts

description: Swiss voters backed a plan to raise pensions, the first time in the country’s history that social benefits got an increase via plebiscite.
title: Swiss Voters Back Higher Pensions, Reject Working Longer

description: A Hamas delegation is heading to Cairo to outline the group’s position on talks that may lead to a temporary cease-fire with Israel, the release of hostages, and the influx of desperately needed aid into Gaza, a senior official said.
title: Hamas Confirms Cairo Truce Talks, Seeks Israeli Concessions

description: When UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt delivers his spring budget on Wednesday, investors in the country’s homebuilders, retailers and investment platforms will be watching with a sense of anticipation.
title: The UK Stocks to Watch Ahead of Chancellor Hunt’s Spring Budget

description: South Korean doctors led thousands of protesters in Seoul on Sunday as a standoff with the government nears a third week, in one of the largest demonstrations yet for a labor action that has slowed the delivery of health care.
title: South Korea Doctors Rally as Government Calls for End to Walkout

description: Ukrainian authorities are worried that President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is vulnerable to a Russian disinformation campaign that will seek to undermine his authority.
title: Ukraine Braced for Russian Disinformation Attacks on Zelenskiy

description: Thailand’s former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was picked as the nation’s most influential politician after he was freed from detention under a special parole, according to a survey.
title: Thaksin Picked as Most Influential Thai Politician in Survey

description: Shehbaz Sharif is set to return as Pakistan’s prime minister after two old-guard parties formed a coalition to keep jailed politician Imran Khan’s party out of power.
title: Pakistan Set to Elect Shehbaz Sharif as New Prime Minister

description: Zhang Xiaoming, Beijing’s former top official for Hong Kong and Macau affairs, has been removed as deputy secretary-general of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference, according to state broadcaster CCTV.
title: China’s Ex-Top Official for HK, Macau Removed From CPPCC Role

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt outlined plans to boost productivity ahead of next week’s annual budget.
title: UK’s Hunt Outlines Plan to Boost Productivity Ahead of Budget
